posts.name: Vanessasaurus
posts.cooked: If I am new to HPC (but perhaps have used Python) what modules should I take a look at?

posts.name: Vanessasaurus
posts.cooked:
There is a really fantastic list of resources I’ve unearthed here:

http://andy.terrel.us/blog/2012/09/27/starting-with-python/

Specifically, it reviews tutorials, Python modules intended for HPC, and resources to help learn about performance, profiling, and scaling. Some of the notes might be a bit old, so if you find an issue please comment on the author’s disqus (at the bottom of the page) to see if an update can be made.

posts.name: Christopher J. Paciorek
posts.cooked: I’d also suggest checking out Dask (https://dask.org/) and Ray (https://github.com/ray-project/ray).

link_counts.title: GitHub - ray-project/ray: A system for parallel and distributed Python that unifies the ML ecosystem.

posts.name: Vanessasaurus
posts.cooked:
Here is another nice post on Python Performance Optimization:

Stack Abuse – 21 Feb 19

Python Performance Optimization

We will optimize common patterns and procedures in Python programming in an effort to boost the performance and enhance the utilization of the available computing resources.

posts.name: Vanessasaurus
posts.cooked:
And here is another great resources that goes through Python bulletins worth learning!

https://treyhunner.com/2019/05/python-builtins-worth-learning/
